Techniques
Monster Rancher Metropolis: My Monster Rancher Archive (Andriod): Miscellaneous Q&A (Post New Questions Here): Techniques
By mongooseroar on Sunday, January 8, 2012 - 09:18 am:

Here are some techs that my monsters have learned. I don't know whether techs differ by sub-breed, so I will list the first sub-breed that I see in my monster wiki that lists the tech.

Baku
(From Higante - Baku/Golem)
Pass Gas: Speed lowered by 30%
Grooming: Defense raised by 30%
Playing: Defense raised by 20%
Rush Recklessly: Life raised by 20%
Continuous Biting: Power raised by 40%
Stamping: Defense raised by 40%


Centaur
(From Blue Gale - Centaur/Tiger)
Death Thrust: Skill raised by 50%
Smash: Power raised by 20%
Exposing Throw: Life raised by 30%
Z Smash: Power raised by 50%
Energy Shots: Intelligence raised by 20%
Triple Strike: Skill raised by 20%

(From Centaur - Centaur/Centaur)
Bray: Defense raised by 20%


Dragon
(From Niezheg - Dragon/Naga)
Petite Breath: Life raised by 20%
Salamander: Intelligence raised by 60%
Trample: Defense raised by 50%
Claw Attack: Power raised by 20%

(From Dragon - Dragon/Dragon)
Fire: Intelligence raised by 20%
Flutter: Speed raised by 20%

(From Rock Dragon - Dragon/Golem)
Wing Attack: Skill raised by 20%


Falco
(From Mewco - Falco/Mew)
Wild Smash: Power raised by 20%
Sigma Hurricane: Life raised by 50%
Headbutt: Defense raised by 20%
Thrust Attack: Power raised by 20%
Hurricane: Life raised by 20%

(From Piroco - Falco/Piroro)
Flying Ripper: Defense raised by 40%
Wild Punch: Power raised by 20%


Golem
(From Golem - Golem/Golem)
Twin Palm Strike: Power raised by 40%
Punch: Power raised by 20%
Beetle Chop: Power raised by 50%
Stone Guard: Defense raised by 20%
Palm Strikes: Power raised by 30%
Tackle: Life raised by 30%
Finger Chop: Skill raised by 150

Hengar
(From Hengar - Hengar/Hengar)
Megaton Hammer: Power raised by 30%
Mixing Echo: Defense lowered by 20%
Beam: Skill raised by 20%

(From Proto Zero - Hengar/???)
Razor Blade: Power lowered by 50%
Burst Cannon: Intelligence raised by 20%


Mocchi
(From Mocchi - Mocchi/Mocchi)
Gotcha: Skill raised by 20%
Slap: Power raised by 20%
I Have Tea: Defense raised by 20%


Pixie
(From Pixie - Pixie/Pixie)
Flame: Intelligence raised by 20%
Throw Kiss: Power lowered by 20%
Somersault: Power raised by 100
Giga Drain: Life lowered by 250


Tiger
(From Tiger - Tiger/Tiger)
Thunder One-Two: Skill raised by 20%
Step: Speed raised by 30%
Super Lightning: Intelligence raised by 30%
Thunder Dash: Speed raised by 20%
Howling Roar: Skill lowered by 40%
Combo: Skill raised by 40%
Force: Defense raised by 20%
Thunder's Shadow: Speed raised by 40%
Bite: Power raised by 20%

By Greek Snake on Monday, January 9, 2012 - 09:19 pm:

I'll add a few for you that I think you missed - forgive me if I repeat anything you already have.

Suezo (Suezo/Suezo)

Lick - Defense lowered by %30
Stop Breath - Defense raised by %10
Psychokinesis - Intelligence raised by %20
Yodel - Skill lowered by %30
(I had one more tech that -speed but I need to find it again...)


Dragon (Dragon/Dragon)
Dragon Breath - Life raised by %40


Mocchi (Mocchi/Mocchi)
Mocchi Gun - Intelligence raised by %40

I'll also add some for naga once I get him out of the freezer since I think he has 6 techs.

Are you compiling any info on where/how to obtain the techs etc?

By mongooseroar on Tuesday, January 10, 2012 - 08:30 pm:

I haven't been particularly good about doing so, but I'm now working on collecting the information as I encounter it.

By Greek Snake on Wednesday, January 11, 2012 - 03:15 pm:

My dragon just learnt Sky Attack - Increase defence my 30% at the new Goat Coast adventure.

It seems a surefire way to get a technique from an area is to send your monsters to defeat the boss monster. The only possible outcomes from a win, in my experience, is either getting the disc of that monster or learning the tech.

By GM on Tuesday, January 31, 2012 - 06:11 pm:

My pure Suezo got this thing here:

Gaze,Skill raised by 30%

And for Durahan/Durahan:

Sword Throw,Life raised by 30%
Divine Thunder,Skill raised by 30%
Cut in Two,Power raised by 20%


So far my monsters have learned techs from either having one of their stats reach a certain level or randomly during adventures.

By mongooseroar on Saturday, February 4, 2012 - 05:38 am:

Color Pandora
(From Pirahnicolo - Color Pandora/Naga)
Hip Attack: Life raised by 20%
Rat Fireworks: Speed raised by 20%
Super Rat Fireworks: Speed raised by (fame*0.5)
Blackhole: Intelligence raised by 40%
Double Hip: Life raised by 40%
Stream Combo: Skill raised by 40%

Super Rat Fireworks (gained at level 12) has the potential to get completely silly.

By Greek Snake on Monday, February 6, 2012 - 05:43 am:

@mongooserroar

WOW. That fame*0.5 is nuts!

Considering I have a suezo with 930 odd fame if only I could transfer that... haha. Or of course, have people give my monster enough gifts... that could be quite the move.

@GM

I don't think your monsters could have possibly learnt a tech from one of their stats reaching a certain level... Monsters naturally learn techs at level 3, level 8 and level 12. Beyond that I haven't seen any.

By tiakall on Monday, February 27, 2012 - 07:28 pm:

Hi guys,

I've made a list of what I've seen so far here: http://mymonsterrancher.wikia.com/wiki/Techniques

From what I've seen, skills are shared by a family, so anything Pixie can have Throw Kiss, for example. I think there's also a pattern to what sort of techniques a monster learns on adventures - I think each area has a different "level" of technique and a monster that gets the technique reward draws from a pool of techniques based on what family it is and what "level" the area is.

By Lisa Shock on Tuesday, February 28, 2012 - 07:05 am:
